name: such

A2 used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis: That's such a good film. It seems like such a long way to drive for just one day. You're such an idiot! Such cruelty really is beyond my comprehension.such (a) ... that It was such a small room that the bed only just fit.
More examplesFewer examplesShe's got such a cheeky grin.He's such a child if he doesn't get his own way.I never knew you were such a good dancer.I really admire people who can work in such difficult conditions.That was such a sad film.

Grammar
SuchWe can use such (as a determiner) before a noun phrase to add emphasis: …
Such as a determinerWe can use such (as a determiner) before a noun phrase to add emphasis: …
Such meaning ‘of this or that kind’In more formal situations, we can use such to mean ‘of this or that kind’. We can use it before a/an or after expressions like the only, the first, the second: …
Such … thatWe can use a that-clause after a noun phrase with such: …
Such or so?Such is a determiner; so is an adverb. They often have the same meaning of ‘very’ or ‘to this degree’: …
Such asWe can use such as to introduce an example or examples of something we mention. We normally use a comma before such as when we present a list of examples. Where there is just one example, we don’t need a comma: …
B2 of a particular or similar type: such as Small companies such as ours are very vulnerable in a recession.such a thing I'm looking for a cloth for cleaning silver. Do you have such a thing? Present on this grand occasion were Andrew Davies, Melissa Peters, and other such stars.in such a way that I tried to tell her in such a way that she wouldn't get offended.some such He said it was an Edwardian washstand or some such thing - I can't remember exactly.and such/suchlike old-fashioned informal I just bought one or two things - bread and milk and such (also suchlike).formal Our lunch was such (= of a type) that we don't really need dinner. such as
A2 for example: That money is to cover costs such as travel and accommodation.

used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis: I’ve never in my life had such delicious food. It seems like such a long way to drive. It was such a pity they missed the show. [ + that clause ] It was such a large fire that over 100 firefighters were on the scene.
such adjective, pronoun
(OF THAT TYPE)
of that or a similar type: With such evidence, they should have no difficulty getting a conviction. Small companies such as ours are having a hard time. They’ll pay our expenses, such as food and lodging. infml We talked about the kids and the weather and such (= and that type of thing).
